alert.note: Alert for Adair; Boone; Dallas; Greene; Guthrie; Hamilton; Hardin; Madison; Polk; Story; Warren; Webster (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 9:39PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Polk, eastern Greene, Story, western Hardin, northern Madison, Webster, eastern Guthrie, Boone, Hamilton, Dallas, northeastern Adair and northwestern Warren Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 939 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Dodge Regional Airport to 8 miles east of Jefferson to 6 miles north of Greenfield. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Des Moines, Ames, West Des Moines, Ankeny, Urbandale, Fort Dodge, Johnston, Clive, Altoona, Waukee, Boone, Norwalk, Pleasant Hill, Grimes, Webster City, Perry, Nevada, Adel, Windsor Heights and Carlisle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 61 and 72, and between mile markers 87 and 151. Interstate 80 between mile markers 87 and 146. Interstate 235 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central, north central and west central Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Boone; Dallas; Greene; Guthrie; Hamilton; Hardin; Madison; Polk; Story; Warren; Webster
